title: Could be the best restaurant in Cambridge
text: Doesn't look like much from the outside but this could be the best restaurant in Cambridge. Very nice, intimate ambience and excellent staff. What adds the wow! factor is the superb food. The menue is set but they will do substitutions if you ask in advance. Seven varied courses with a superb mix of flavours. Delicious!

title: Excellent monument
text: make this part of your Belem district visit. It's well worth seeing. Imposing, great detail up close, excellent photo-op.

title: It's not what you see it's how you see it?
text:
Judging by the mixed reviews this is obviously a very "marmite" attraction.

I can only say that we enjoyed it and that maybe the quality of the tour makes a big difference. We had a small boat with only a few passengers and could even get outside to take some good photos. The guide was informative and gave a more general talk about Amsterdam's history.

But yes, it is just lights next to and in the canals.

title: decent restaurant with some problems
text:
I'll just repeat what others say about the table carpets. The need a good vacuuming.
Huge portions but the good is only adequate. Service poor by Dutch standards but it's a good location and atmospheric.

title: Tasty Dutch food
text:
Unpretentious atmospheric restaurant with tasty local food.

Recommend the Grandma's stew or the stamppots.

title: A pleasant history lesson.
text: This is a good place to visit, possibly as a break in a longer walk. Nicely done and informative. Has a nice coffee shop in the basement.

title: Excellent art gallery & museum
text:
Rembrandt's Nightwatch anyone? Here's where you see it and it's the centrepiece to an excellent museum. Large but very well set out. Plenty to see in a two hour visit.
There's a very nice restaurant if you can get a seat. Book online to avoid queuing to get on a queue.
place: Skip the Line: Rijksmuseum Amsterdam Entrance Ticket

title: A pilgrimage site.
text:
If you're a VvG fan - and I mean really a fan - this is the place you've always wanted to visit. Make sure you go.
However, it doesn't have a lot beyond the paintings themselves. I felt I didn't learn a lot and there's not much imagination used in the display.
There's a mediocre restaurant - try the Rijksmuseum 's across the square instead - and the obligatory gift shop.
place: Van Gogh Museum Ticket in Amsterdam

title: Fantastic canal district hotel
text:
Everything about this hotel is classy. It looks great, it's atmospheric and the location is superb and convenient for just about anywhere you want to visit in Amsterdam.
Breakfast is excellent and there's a nice cocktail bar for an evening wind-down. We didn't use the restaurant but there are plenty of places to eat within a few minutes of the hotel.
If you want wow! factor how about this: the hotel has its own canal boat.
Most of all the staff are super helpful and friendly. Full of advice.
A class act all round.

title: I feel like I’ve been mugged
text:
The church stole thirty euros from me!!!! “Art installation” is five minutes of dangerous darkness.
What if you wanted to see a church?

title: Very cold
text:
Probably the worst premier inn I’ve stayed in. The room was freezing when I got there and took hours to warm up.
The restaurant was very slow but breakfast was up to usual PI standards. Location good down by the canal which is surprisingly nice morning walk.
place: Premier Inn Manchester Old Trafford hotel

title: Not really a stand-alone attraction
text:
A historic little church with an interesting history and really, reall old but somewhere to use as a location for something else.

We went to a live ghost story reading - which was excellent - and the chapel provided a nicely atmospheric backdrop.
place: St Mary Magdalene / Leper Chapel (The) - (Church of England)

title: A proper castle
text:
This is a proper castle with battlements on top of the highest hill in town.

Great photo ops and the best place to see Lisbon from up high.

title: One of the Lisboin must-sees
text:
A top historic site, this is an atmospheric and distinctive building and is well situated for other Belem attractions. Make time for a visit.

Massive queue warning! Long, chaotic queues. Get a Lisbon Pass.

title: Not good enough
text:
I can only compare like with like and this restaurant sets itself up as fine dining and is the food is simply not good enough.

Ingrediants are shoved on to the plate with no apparent thought to the overall experience. I ate most of it but my wife couldn't stomach some of the dishes.

Warning: set menue! No veggie options!

Second warning: chipped a tooth on the chorizzo gravel. Eat carefully.

title: Nice restaurant with excellent city views
text: This was the best restaurant we found in Lisbon, which isn't saying much but we thoroughly enjoyed our evening. Good food and excellent atmosphere. Book early to get a view!

title: Can a tram route be tourist attraction?
text:
It can in Lisbon where the roads are a battlezone and the trams rule the winding, glorious, steep, sqeezy streets. A cross between rollercoaster and public transport.

warning: to get a window seat, queuing will be involved! On the other hand, save time by using an ATM as you go past.

title: Plenty of WOW! but a few hms.
text:
Plenty of the wow factor you need/demand/expect from a high end resort but there are a couple of quibbles about the food.

Room: excellent. Clean, well equiped, superb view of the gardens.

Ambience: superb. A really well designed landscape with plenty of areas to just stroll or sit and enjoy the serene atmosphere.

Beach: lovely sandy beach with clean water for swimming and plenty of space.

Food: choice a bit limited, quality not bad - maybe not 5* standard - but there is a better restaurant upstairs and there was a Friday BBQ which was great. Nice breakfast with plenty of choice.

Service from Reception was a bit patchy.

Overall a memorable stay. We genuinely lost track of time and thoroughly de-stressed very quickly. The gardens are a real show stopper.

title: Captures the essence of Lisboa
text:
This great little hotel captures the essence of the city. Quirky but not gimmicky, well equiped room, nice breakfast, lovely courtyard and the usual small museum in the basement.
The staff were especially fantastic and couldn't do enough.
Well located for the Castle do St Jorge and the Alfama district but there's no getting away from the fact that Lisbon is steep and there will be vertical walking involved. Public transport is plentiful, however and the hotel has a golf-cart for short journeys.
place: Solar Do Castelo, a Lisbon Heritage Collection

title: Great photo op
text:
Fantastic views of the city and the surrounding area. We enjoyed the glass floor.
It's a bit pricey for a photo oppotunity.
place: Emirates Spinnaker Tower Portsmouth Entrance Ticket

title: If you only see one thing in Portsmouth...
text:
A fantastic museum built around a wonderful artefact. Bags of atmosphere. Tons of informative exhibits. Lives up to the cliche, "brings history to life."
Reasonable price, no significant queues, lots of cafes in the area for spot of lunch or a coffee.

title: Worth a trip if you live in Cambridge
text: It's a couple of miles for us but if we fancy Chinese take away it's the only choice. Excellent chips. Loses a point for cash only policy.

title: Good atmosphere good food
text: This has developed into a good restaurant. Attentive staff. Good menus. Nice atmosphere. I had pork with rhubarb a very interesting combination and was impressed but this opinion in our group was split. It seems mains are inconsistent but the starters are lovely.

title: Not that cheap, pretty nasty.
text:
Adequate for cheap & nasty class but the website is VERY unclear about luggage and we had to pay extra.

Good legroom but we paid for it. priority boarding waste of time.

title: Excellent service
text: Couldn’t be happier with our airport transfers. On time efficient easy to book and reasonably priced. Would recommend.

title: A missed opportunity for the Athens tourist board
text: This has the potential to be a tourist magnet but it's an actively unpleasant experience. A very short ride in an ugly tunnel. At the top there are fabulous views but they can't take credit for that!

title: Best view in town
text:
I'll admit we mostly went for the view but enjoyed the experience as a last night treat.

Excellent service and good food. As all the other reviews say it's pricy for Athens but you'd pay a lot more for similar in London. I

And the location is fabulous.

title: A class above the other restaurants on this street
text:
A nice well located restaurant with good service & good food.

Pricier than the others in the area but worth it. Had an excellent giant salad and a couple of very nice starters

title: kleftico and chips? WT...?
text:
Nice atmosphere and probably better for a drink or lunch rather than an evening meal.

looks the part but there are much nicer restaurants just around the corner. Kleftiko is my favourite Greek dish and I knew things weren't good when it took so long to arrive. Dry meat and soggy chips. My wife had a better experience.

title: Not much to see
text:
Not much to see here to be honest or perhaps we'd reached ruins saturation point.

Worth a quick visit but a little bit TOO ruined if you know what I mean.

title: Underrated
text:
I'm surprised this collection of ruins isn't given higher ratings. It's a very nice sure with lots of atmosphere.

Worth a visit and some good day Go to ops.

title: A really nice visit
text:
A great space to wander around and soak up the atmosphere. There's an excellent temple and a great view of the Acropolis.

Well worth making time for.

title: Quantity over quality
text:
I was a bit disappointed as our guide said this was the best museum in Athens. It isn't by a long way.

A very random and indiscriminate collection with no real Wow! exhibits. I nearly always post a pic with my reviews but there wasn't anything worth taking.

title: A nice enough walk I suppose.
text: Not sure why this place is such a tourist draw. Lots of chances to buy your fridge magnets. Go at night it's more atmospheric.

title: You're already planning to go.
text:
If you're in Athens you're either going to see this or you already have.

In the climb there's a real sense of what these sacred sites meant to the ancients. Up close the buildings are a thrill if you're even slightly interested in history.

A thousand selfie ops but make sure you take time to look and see.

title: A must see follow up to the Acropolis.
text:
If you visit the Acropolis - I mean of course WHEN you visit the Acropolis - follow it up with this beautifully designed and fascinating museum.
Worth it just for the excellent canteen.

title: Feel the centuries.
text:
If you like your history and you're in Athens make sure to visit this superb museum. You've seen many of the exhibits in the covers of books and here's your chance to see THAT golden mask and THAT statue of Zeus up close.

Something fascinating around every corner.

We were only there for a couple of hours but wish we had longer.

title: Great food experience
text:
Very high quality Restaurant tucked away in North Norfolk. A completely unexpected find. A great space, excellent service we were made welcome throughout.
enough about the restaurant And what about the food? A superb gallery of tastes, beautifully cooked. A great experience.
Not cheap but you'd pay a lot more for this kind of fine dining in a more urban location.

title: Sunday lunch a real treat
text: We often come here for Sunday lunch and it's always a real treat. Really tasty food and good portions. Prices reasonable for the area. The pub is a nice setting and there's sneaky parking across the road. Warning: always very busy.

title: For a pizza place, it's excellent
text:
Nice atmosphere, good location - central-ish.
Had two evening meals, excellent pizza which is - of course - their speciality but also nice pasta dishes.

title: Nice restaurant, ordinary food
text:
Has a great ambience and nice location. The service was impeccable. The prices were fine for this kind of establishment.
Unfortunately, the food was a disappointment. We went for Sunday lunch. It was adequate and the starter was nice but there are much, much, better places in Cambridge.

title: Brought back memories of Seville
text:
This niche restaurant is very busy and deserves to be.
The really nicely designed space reminded us of our Seville holiday. With all the tiles we could almost be back in our favourite tapas bar in Triana.
Yes, it seemsa bit pricy but Tapas is expensive in Spain, too.
A varied menu with all your favourites. Most importantly, of course, the food. Superb.

title: Lacks class & wow factor
text:
Excellent location with fantastic views. Beach good for swimming but a bit small. Quite distant from anything else on the island, expensive taxis needed to get to Corfu old town or Paleokastritsa.
For food it may be best to head out. The beach bar isn't great. There are two restaurants, one posh but with a limited menue, the other a very expensive cafeteria.
Room well equiped with a superb view. The hotel has a very nice style.
Has aspirations to being a five star hotel but lacks the class and wow factor to really match up but if you're only there for sun it will probably do.

title: Good food, superb atmosphere
text:
We spent a lovely evening at this excellent high-end restaurant. A varied menue, the vacuum-cooked lamb was excellent.
The most striking thing is the setting which is superbly atmospheric and makes it a memorable experience beyond the meal iteself. A big thank you to the staff.
Not cheap, allow plenty of time and make sure you know the way, Corfu Town is a labyrinth!

title: A great little hotel
text:
I wouldn't usually bother to review for a one-night stay but this little hotel is exceptional.
We were probably a bit demamnding but the staff were super-helpful. Corfu Town is tiny, so you can walk anywhere in minutes but the Vittoria is away from the hubub.

title: A must-see if you're at all touristy.
text:
A fascinating labyrinth with some good bars and restaurants, two fortresses, nice public open spaces.
My good lady said it was very like Venice (no canals).
An absolute labyrinth, so get a map!

title: A beach with its own monastery
text: The best baech in Corfu according to our taxi driver and it's difficult to argue. Had a nice swim and laze on the sand, then went to the monastery in the evening.

title: Worth the climb
text:
Worth the climb, or you could drive up I suppose. Lots of coaches go up all day so a late visit may be just the thing.
Excellent sea views and a very serence astmosphere - even in a thunderstorm!
It's free to get in but it would be polite to buy a candle. There's a dress code but not too strict.

title: Biggest church in the world?
text:
Biggest church in the world? It depends on the source but there's more to it than size with a spectacular interior and lots to see in an hour or two. Christopher Columbus' tomb alone makes it a must see but everywhere you look there's something to see.
We queued up to get in, before it opened. The queue was huge but surprisingly quick, but even so, advance booking is the way to go.
As they said: "Let us build a church so beautiful and so grand that those who see it finished will think we are mad!" They certainly did.

title: We didn't expect much from this but...
text: A stunning space in the city, far more interesting than it sounds in the guide books. Seville is a tiled city and the Plaza is one of the most and best tiled site. Also, an excellent fountain and a Venice-esque canal for boat rides. (We didn't take one.)

title: It's already on your list
text:
It's already on your list. If not, are you sure you're going to Seville?
The most historic and most beautiful attraction in a beautiful and historic city. You could easily spend three hours in here, even if you don't get lost in the maze.
Online booking very strongly advised as you get to cut in on hundreds of irate fellow tourists who didn't bother.

title: Primer
text: Interesting but maybe a bit dry for my tastes. Best seen as a primer for seeing some actual Flamenco but you get a real feel for the deep historical connection with the region.

title: Superb high-end beach hotel
text:
We had the princess sea-view room. Excellent well-equipped, quite large, and a view to remember. The hotel is compact and attractively designed, which enhances the serene, relaxing atmosphere. There is an excellent beach restaurant, Sensei, and several restaurants for the evening, one pricey but excellent, but you're an eight euro taxi ride from Lindos which is full of places to eat. Special big efcharisto to the staff who are friendly and helpful and really made us feel welcome.
One minor quibble: there seems to be a lot of confusion about what the various packages mean. It's worth asking for those perks. The beach gazebos come with a mini-fridge, perfect for keeping your beer cold!
In short, highly recommended and we plan to come back in a couple of years.

title: Excellent full-moon night
text: Quality, atmospheric restaurant. If you're at the Aquagrand make sure you spend one evening here. Or two, we came back for the full-moon evening on our last day.

title: Very nice restaurant
text: Very nice surroundings. Attentive staff. Varied menu. Prices a little higher than Lindos average but classier restaurant. Starters a bit average but the slow cooked pork belly was delicious. Excellent for post-Acropolis evening.

title: Very good ruins
text: If you're staying anywhere near Lindos this is already on your list and is well worth it. The climb looks intimidating from the ground but isn't too arduous. Proper Greek ruins with columns and a stunning view of St Paul's Bay. Careful with opening times!!

title: Very charming town
text: Very picturesque with winding streets full of restaurants. And gift shops! Climb the Acropolis and get a stunning view.

title: Excellent Greek restaurant
text: We found this in a tourist guide (not TA) and it was well worth seeking out. Charming and very atmospheric. The staff were very welcoming. Food excellent and reasonably priced. We both had the kleftico lamb - something of a house speciality - and it was flavoursome and filling. Thoroughly enjoyed the experience and would certainly go again.

title: A fun little film
text: A "9D" experience. Quite a lot of fun, just the right length and a good start for a visit to the Old Town. Staff a bit brusque.

title: Decent restaurant
text: Decent restaurant with okay food. Not expensive. Top level has stunning view of Lindos. Probably. It was too full to get a table but the middle level was fine.
